result.execSummary:
The defendant Dahir Nigel Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court orderd that all mandatory court costs, fees, surchages including the DNA and victim witness surcharge and restitutio be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.

Concurrent with: * July 5, 2022/Judge Mark Sanders: Court ordered the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 85 days of sentence credit on counts one and two. *
Concurrent with count 2 and concurrent with sentence in 18CF4336; but consecutive to any other case.  Credit for 86 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISOIN AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to be monitored by the Mental Health Unit.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is advied as a conviicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/weapons.
The Court advised the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dahir Nigel Evans

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing ( 55 pages) commencing 04-15-2022 by Kelly L. Pierce.
Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing Corrected Title Page ( 55 pages) commencing 04-15-2022 by Kelly L. Pierce.
Denying Request for Reconsideration, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Letter from defendant re:  ERP.  (Dahir N. Evans - #496993, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Order Amending Judgment Of Conviction

-  the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 85 days of sentence credit on counts one and two, and a copy of the same shall be forwarded to the Department.

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag

Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in custody.  Brittany Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised Defendant as a convicted felon he may not possesSW a firearm/weapon and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.  



Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 & CONCURRENT to sentence in 18CF4336 but CONSECUTIVE to any other case with credit for 86 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 & CONCURRENT to sentence in 18CF4336 but CONSECUTIVE to any other case with credit for 86 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:

-Mental Health Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate. 
-Defendant to be monitored by the Mental Health Unit.
-AODA Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
-Random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain full time employment.
-Restitution set at zero.
-The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/weapons.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Dahir Nigel Evans not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was tabbed to Judge Havas in error. Defendant has a pending case before Judge Sanders.  This case is being retabbed to Judge Sanders, Br. 28.
Case is adjourned to 4-15-22 at 3:00 pm for plea and sentencing before Judge Sanders.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending matter regarding case 18CF4336 and conviction regarding case 06CF2691. Sworn for the State: P.O. Ryan Maxcey - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dahir Nigel Evans in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dahir Nigel Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
